Key Match Events: LeBron James had eight second-quarter points while Anthony Davis finished the first half with 18.
The Pistons leaned on a balanced scoring attack to offset the Lakers superstars' output.
Anthony Davis anchoring the middle, the visitors limited the Detroit Pistons to 16 points in the period.
Cade Cunningham, Ron Holland II and Jaden Ivey dragged the hosts to a 115-103 win.
Post-Match Reflections: The Pistons improved its record to 3-5 while Los Angeles dropped to 4-3.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Playing on short rest, the Pistons came out fast and grabbed a 15-7 lead after five minutes.
Behind Tim Hardaway Jr. and Tobias Harris, Detroit put the home team ahead 33-22 after one quarter.
Los Angeles faced an 83-77 deficit entering the final frame after trailing by 18 points.
Others: The LA Lakers continued their five-game road swing with a matchup against the Detroit Pistons on Monday.
Anthony Davis, a game-time decision, finished with 37 points, nine rebounds and four assists.
LeBron James contributed 20 points, 11 assists and eight rebounds.
